content.description: This west-facing climb will cause you to use a couple techniques up it.  It starts off with balancey climbing.  Not much to hold..., it turns into, after the ledge, a pumpy finish.  Pump it out as there isn't much resting.  A nice line that seems longer than it is.
content.protection: 7 draws for the climb and 2 bolts for the anchors.  Bring long draws for the anchors as they are set back over the edge.
content.location: Located dead-center of the wall. Start on a ramp to reach the first bolt.

climbs.name: Rager's Edge
climbs.fa: Mike Kurilich, Mark Sargent, Phil Baldwin July 2009

content.description:
A mix of Dylan Thomas and Somerset Maugham.

Start about 5 meters up from the start of Grrr-Amp just below a steep arête/overhanging corner. Clamber up 15 ft to a flat ledge and reach high (or stickclip) 1st bolt. Gym like moves to big holds beyond the lower crux. From the large ledge after the crux enjoy the fun climbing to the top following the arête going left and right, clipping bolts in the 5.9 range.  Finish at the same anchor for Grrr-Amp.  11 bolts total. 30 meters
content.location: Start about 5 meters up from the start of Grrr-Amp just below a steep arête/overhanging corner.

climbs.name: Heeere's Johnny
climbs.fa: Maybe? Carl Dec, Thomas Batey, Paul Richer

content.description:
Climb the finger crack that splits the wall between Ragers Edge and Redrum to ledge, 40'. Clip the bolt off the ledge and finish straight up on

Redrum

, 5.10 or move up and left to finish on R

agers Edge

, easier.
content.protection:
Standard rack to #2 Camalot, a few extra finger size pieces. 4 draws for

Redrum

finish, 6 with a couple of long runners for

Ragers Edge

.
content.location:
The obvious crack that splits the wall then goes into right facing corner between

Ragers Edge

and and

Redrum

.
